article_text:
FRANKFURT—Thomas Sedran markets an iconic luxury-car brand to Europeans who love luxury cars. One hitch: He's pitching Cadillacs in the land of BMWs, Audis and Mercedes.

Cadillac "is now much more suitable for European markets than it used to be," he said ahead of the Geneva International Motor Show that begins this week and provides a showplace for Europe's biggest auto announcements. "The brand's revival in Europe...

twitter.description: General Motors' luxury-car brand this week takes to one of Europe's top auto shows to unveil a coming turbocharged sport coupe, which is poised to take on BMW, Audi and Mercedes-Benz models.
twitter.title: Selling Cadillacs in BMW's Heartland

image.alt: Cadillac goes on the offensive this week in the land of BMWs

article_summary:
FRANKFURT—Thomas Sedran markets an iconic luxury-car brand to Europeans who love luxury cars.
One hitch: He's pitching Cadillacs in the land of BMWs, Audis and Mercedes.
"The brand's revival in Europe...
Cadillac "is now much more suitable for European markets than it used to be," he said ahead of the Geneva International Motor Show that begins this week and provides a showplace for Europe's biggest auto announcements.
